text: Sample @ MBCC 2017, Green session. Light hazy brownish pour with a small head. Notes. of dried fruits, figs, caramel, prunes and apples.

Draught at MBCC 2017. Low fluffy quickly disappearing light brown head. Pitch black body. Sweet roasted malt dried fruit caramel aroma. Spicy sweet buorbon wineous vanilla flavor. Low carbonation, long finish.

duft. karamel svag vanilje fad rosin
smag ristet bourbon karamel sødlig rosin fed tyk smag dadler
Tap @ MBC 2017. Dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of deep toffee, boozy, dried fruits, brown sugar., chewy caramel, figs. Heavy sweet with loads of barrel pressence, light ryebread.

0,05l from tap at mbcc green session shared by / with the crew. As Voodoo Tenacious Wee Bourbon BA Wee Heavy 11.7%. almost black color, small coffee colored head. smells of wood, bourbon, booze, molasses, bit glueish. rather heavy but still very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of molasses, some wood, bourbon, molasses, light coconut. finishes light to medium sweet with notes of bourbon, molasses and light coconut. very nice but rather heavy.

8, 4, 8, 3, 14
Pours very dark brown with a low white head. Aromas of caramel, figs, dates, toffee, vanilla. Taste is caramel and toffee with oak character. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chocolate, bourbon, vanilla. Taste is rich bourbon sweet with a gentle sweet finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.
On tap at MBCC. Dark brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel and dried fruit with dessert wine. Sweet fruity flavour with vanilla, caramel and plenty booze

Bottle thanks to Jason. Pours a dark brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is bourbon, wood, vanilla, roast. Medium body, dark chocolate, caramel, roast, tobacco, wood, boozy finish, very good.

22oz bottle number 125. Pours out black topped with a small head. Nose is big roast malts bourbon barrel vanilla chocolate sweetness marshmallows coffee. Taste is more of the heavy barrel treatment marshmallow sweetness plenty of chocolate malts and roast.

Pours a dark chocolate brown color thats nearly opaque with dark mocha/mahogany edges and a one finger beige head that quickly settles into a thin ring. Mediocre retention, disappearing mid way through the pour with minimal spotty lacing left behind. Carbonation looks low but this beer has nice color.

Sweet boozy aroma with a really nice barrel presence thats nicely integrated into the notes of the base. Slightly charred oak with sweet, boozy bourbon, toasted coconut and silky vanilla bean. Underneath, there is faint roast with coffee bean and burnt malt countered by luscious, dessert-like sweetness. Hints of bakers chocolate, fudge and licorice. Smells pretty nice with pleasant barrel notes but could use heavier roast.

Medium body, slightly viscous with soft carbonation and prominent barrel notes. Charred oak, spicy bourbon and vanilla stand out without obliterating the other flavors. Underneath, theres a nice balance of dark roast and lighter malt sweetness. Malt bill is more robust than nose hinted out but still less than expected. Charred toast, burnt sugar, coffee bean and bitter dark chocolate countered by caramel, toffee and dessert-like sweetness. Well balanced, complex and deceptively drinkable.
Pours a hazy darker brown with off-white head. Whiskey, caramel, nuts, dark fruits on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with a raisin and whiskey sweetness.

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland ! Pours a deep mahogany color with a touch of sienna on the edges and a thin veil of eggshell foam. A bit oxidized with notes of flat cola, cardboard, nutty bourbon, stale malt, orange peel, bitter rancid peanuts.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2015 22oz bottle pours dark brown black with medium fizzy head. Nose is nice initially with some caramel, chocolate, and nutty sweetness. On the palate things fall apart, very thin watery body, some bitter nutty chocolate, light ashy chocolate, and cola, there is a bit of a tangy note creeping in that seems to be heading in a weird direction. Finishes thin, light roast, dark bitter chocolate, stale cola, a bit sticky. Past its prime and not very good anymore, unfortunately.
Black pour, smaller head. Huge bourbon aroma, scotch. Surprisingly smooth considering the abv. Bourbon, scotch, earthy. Heavier bodied. A sipper
Big bourbon and alcohol aroma. Coffee anmd bourbon taste. Fuller mouthfeel. Good sipper.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours about as dark as a stout. The aroma presents caramel, dark chocolate and a rumor of cinnamon. Ultra Full-bodied with a velvety mouthfeel and relaxed carbonation. The rich flavor is a malty and spicy swirl of sweet caramel, candied tree nuts and mocha with hints of cinnamon and maple preceding a warm bourbon component. Roasty-sweet, burnt marshmallow and bourbon finish. Kudos to landhoney for providing this world-class beer!

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2015 Pours dark with a soft foam head that dissipates to hug my glass. The aroma is of inviting bourbon, oak, dark malt character, sweet burnt buttery caramel like syrup, and vanilla. Tasting I picked up on warming bourbon, a blending of malts and syrup sweetner. The balance between sweetness and bitterness was enjoyable with a pleasant dry boozy bite. I was surprised that this beverage did not affect my palate more. The finish was rather great. It was on the threshold of too much bourbon and too much booze but with the blending of ingredients it tamed those intensities. Overall a hell of a beverage. It is hard not to appreciate this.

[6681-20140816] Bottle. Soya sauce roasted grains aroma. Black body with a quick foamy tan head. More soya sauce and roasted beef in the flavour. Full body. Interesting. (7/3/7/4/15) 3.6
(@ Campground Brewdown 2014, Millmont, PA)
Overheard: "Youll find me under the tap."

2014-08-16. Black body with a small tan head. 3++ Aroma of rich dark malt and bourbon. Flavour is similar with a sweet rich dark malt base and bourbon character throughout. Dryish roast and bourbon lingers. Smooth medium to full bodied palate, soft carbonation. Rich, but the base isnt sufficiently supportive of the bourbon at this point in the evening. Bottle at Campground Brewdown

Bottle. Pours a pure black color with a small beige head, almost no carb. The aroma is wonderful: huge barrel, oak, molasses, smoke. Sweet, woody, sugary, hot, boozy big sweet barrels, cherries, some smoke, vanilla, a bit of leather. Smoky and really it tastes oxidized in a way I like. A sort of unique take in total. Very good.

Woodshed 3.0! Big thanks to dak for saving this whole series and sharing with us. Awesome!! Bottle pours with a mahogany colored body that supports a tan head of foam. The aroma offers up sweet malts, chocolate, vanilla and then a mix of molasses and bourbon. The taste has malt and molasses smoothed over dark roasted malts and brown sugar dusted chocolate brownie. It then gets into a firm degree of bourbon and booze creating a nice balance to the sweetness. Tasty stuff as the roasted malts and barrel notes go together well here and surprising little sense of the big ole ABV.
Light brown pour at Woodshed 3.0. Rich honey, maple, sherry, brown sugar and bourbon notes. One of the better barrel aged beers from Voodoo.

Bottle shared @ Woodshed 3.0! Thanks again to Dak for providing this one! Chestnut, copper, mahogany, and cashew...colors adjust based on the light. Werthers Original, maple, oak, caramel chews, vanilla, and toffee accompanied by a subtle bourbon sweetness. Coating mouthfeel but an invisible alcohol kick. Solid.
This one poured a lighter brown with a beige head. aroma was of lots and lots of bourbon with a toasty caramel taste. Flavor was the same, lots of booze, but tasty big wee heavy underneath.

Sampled on draft at Hou Thou this beer poured a black color with a small foamy beige head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was very strong bourbon, coconut, vanilla and almost hot peppers. The flavor was very strong bourbon, wood, coconut, chocolate, vanilla, port wine, sweet malts and a hint of anise. Astoundingly boozy but it worked for me. Just a incredible amount of depth to the flavor. Very long finish. Very thick and full body. Marvelous.
Bottle number 300 shared by Seth. Cola and bourbon aromas. Brown pour with no real head. Low rent shit bourbon, cola, and sweet caramel notes. The barrel killed this version. Good body and mouthfeel.
A nice, fairly stock standard be scotch ale. Caramel and vanilla and hints of molasses, the aroma greatly outpaces the too sweet flavors.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2014 Bottle shared by Rich, notes of marshmallow, maple, oak, bourbon fruit, chocolate, sugar and scotch peat. I like these eagle rare barrels. A little hot, but rich as hell. Would have thought this was a Russian but nice scotch ale.
Pours black as night with a chocolate head. Sweet chocolate notes with a nice amount of bourbon to back it up. Taste is loaded with the bourbon, good vanilla and oak woodiness.
Bottle #120 thanks to charule. Pours a dark brown with no head. Aroma of vanilla and caramel and alcohol. Taste is a bit too hot for me but still a very good beer. Medium mouth feel. Low carb.

Bottle from release day at Voodoo. Poured in large Voodoo snifter, dark amber brown with a cream film. Crazy aroma of bourbon booze apple vanilla slight soy. Light carb med bod. A little bourbon heavy which I like, slight sweet maltyness. Stings a tad. Tasty.
From a 22 ounce bottle. Silver wax. #218. Oily and slick. Big trace of bourbon throughout. Oak. Vanilla. Tasty.

651mL silver wax shared at Woodshop 8. Pours a clear, deep ruby brown with low foam. Nose is excellent bourbon barrel, no tomato paste, some starchy sweet potato. Taste is spicy, big toasted coconut, rich. Palate is dense, silky, coconut oil. Very nice.

Bottle, shared 5 ways about right, the pour is a dark black, maybe with a little purple. Light head, aroma was bourbon and heavy sweet malts. The taste was not as much bourbon as I would expected. Quite a heavy beer with heavy mouth feel. There was some licorice in there, some barley, and it finishes with bourbon. A lot like a barley wine. This is drinking well now but I can see this improving well with age

bomber shared by ontbeermaker. he waited 5 hours in line to buy this, then i scoop him on first rate. thx andrew. massive bourbon, massive sweetness, very thick. not a lot of brews could integrate this much bourbon character and still hold their own as a beer but this did. this ones a sipper. we shared a bomber 5 ways and it was still a little much.
